channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Defense secretary argues women, racial diversity 'make us stronger' as Trump admin looms
item.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin argued women and diversity make America's military "stronger" on Wednesday.

item.title: From TV doctor to Trump insider: How Dr. Mehmet Oz built his empire and found political power
item.description: Trump appointed Oz to the President's Council on Sports, Fitness and Nutrition during his first term.

item.title: What, exactly, is a bomb cyclone?
item.description: Storm blasts Oregon, Northern California and Washington.

item.title: Le Corbeau, a Regime-Change Classic
item.description: Clouzot’s moral-horror film is a perfect metaphor.

item.title: Ford plans 4,000 more job cuts in Europe as EVs lose momentum
item.description: The reductions amount to around 14% of Ford European workforce and will primarily hit operations in Germany and the U.K. by the end of 2027.

item.title: A Guide for Investment Analysts: Working with Historical Market Data
item.description: Interested in working with older historical data? Pitfalls lurk for the unwary.

item.title: Michigan Democrats Pass Bills That Would Give Trans People Exclusive Legal Privileges When Accusing Others Of Violence
item.description: Republican state Sen. Jim Runestad expressed concern that prosecutors could politically weaponize the provisions in the bills.

item.title: The key to a long life is avoiding the ‘poisonous 5 P’s,’ says one of the world’s top anti-aging experts

item.title: Hovde’s Right: ‘Troubling Issues’ Dogged Milwaukee On Election Day
item.description: Swing state Wisconsin's largest city has a history of election administration messes that have eroded trust in Milwaukee's elections.

item.title: Six Action Items Trump And A GOP Congress Should Pass To Secure Our Elections
item.description: Despite Trump's victory, there are still gaps in election law ripe for abuse by bad actors seeking to disrupt the electoral process.

item.title: Colorado To Pay $1.5 Million For Violating Christian Resident’s Religious Freedoms
item.description: 'This is a win not just for me but for all Americans — for those who share my beliefs and for those who hold different views,' Lorie Smith said.

item.title: California voters reject measure that would have raised minimum wage to nation-high $18 per hour
item.description: Voters in California have rejected a ballot measure that would have raised the state minimum wage to $18 per hour by 2026, the highest in the country.

item.title: Better Energy
item.description: President-elect Trump’s early picks want to end the Biden administration’s myopic attention on green energy to focus on what works.

item.title: Trump taps former acting AG Matthew Whitaker as NATO ambassador
item.description: President-elect Trump on Wednesday announced former Acting Attorney General Matthew Whitaker as his choice for U.S. ambassador to NATO.

item.title: Book Review: The M&A Failure Trap
item.description: Massive M&A deals make headlines but too rarely make money for stockholders.

item.description: President Trump would not be well served by having an attorney general who was preoccupied for a year or more with his own fate.

item.title: Trump picks Linda McMahon for education secretary
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump announced Tuesday that he had selected his transition co-chair Linda McMahon to serve as education secretary.

item.title: Republicans Must Defend Matt Gaetz To End The Use Of Salacious Lies As A Political Weapon
